section.title: Verb patterns 2
section.sectiontitle: Some verbs can be followed by both the infinitive and the -ing form, but with a change in meaning.
section.text1: I always remember to do my homework.
section.text1a: I remember doing my homework, but I can't find it anywhere.
section.text2: During the trip, he stopped to check the engine, which was making a funny noise.
section.text2a: He stopped driving because he was too old.
section.sectiontitle2: Some verbs of perception (hear, watch, etc.) can be followed by object + infinitive without to or object + -ing form, with very little change in meaning.
section.text4: I heard the dog breathe beside me.
section.text4a: I heard the dog breathing beside me.
